intro: Schmidelia varians, commonly known as the variable schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves, which are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and are clustered in umbels, attracting various pollinators. Schmidelia varians is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
